intro: Heptapleurum mangiferifolium var. mangiferifolium, commonly known as the mango-leaf heptapleurum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Actinidiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of India and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that resemble the shape of a mango leaf, hence its common name. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
